intro: Apodanthera fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered stickleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a hairy texture. Apodanthera fasciculata is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions.
